title: How to Cancel or Accept a Pending Payment on Cash App

steps.title: Open the Cash App app.
steps.content: Open the Cash App app. This looks like a white dollar sign with a green background. If you aren't already logged in, enter your phone number or email and tap Next to do so now. Cash App is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store . You cannot cancel an instant payment. You will only be able to cancel a payment if it's marked as "Pending". [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the clock icon.
steps.content: Tap the clock icon. This will open your transaction history.

steps.title: Tap the pending transaction.
steps.content: Tap the pending transaction. This will be underneath the Pending header.

steps.title: Tap Cancel.
steps.content: Tap Cancel . If you don't see this option, you may need to tap ••• first.

steps.title: Tap Yes.
steps.content: Tap Yes . This will cancel the pending payment. If the payment has already been sent to another person, you can ask them to refund the payment instead. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Cash App app.
steps.content: Open the Cash App app. This looks like a white dollar sign with a green background. In most cases, Cash App payments will be accepted automatically. Use this method if you have a pending payment. If you see the message: Cash App pending payment will deposit shortly, the funds should typically be available in your balance within 1-3 business days.

steps.title: Tap the clock icon.
steps.content: Tap the clock icon. This will open your transaction history.

steps.title: Tap the pending transaction.
steps.content: Tap the pending transaction. This will be underneath the Pending header.

steps.title: Enter the amount you want to accept.
steps.content: Enter the amount you want to accept. You can enter the exact amount or an amount less than the total.

steps.title: Tap Accept.
steps.content: Tap Accept . This will complete the transaction.

steps.title: If a payment is pending, it usually means action is needed.
steps.content: If a payment is pending, it usually means action is needed. In most cases, Cash App payments are available instantly after sending or receiving payments. When a payment is pending, it could indicate an issue with incorrect payment details, insufficient funds, account status, or bank processing time. [3] X Research source If you're unable to cancel or approve a payment manually, you can contact Cash App . Otherwise, the issue will typically solve itself within 24-48 hours. [4] X Research source Make sure your payment methods are correct and your account is verified. Unverified accounts have limits placed on their account for security reasons. Alternatively, Cash App could be experiencing internal system issues. This could prevent them from processing your payment. In this case, you can check Cash App's status page to ensure all services are working properly.
